Key Match Events: Quinton de Kock hits fourth century of tournament before falling for 114
Van der Dussen makes 133 and Miller adds 53 off just 30 balls
South Africa post 357-4 after being put in
Keshav Maharaj claims four wickets, Marco Jansen three, Coetzee two and Rabada one
South Africa dismiss New Zealand for 167 to win by 190 runs
Post-Match Reflections: Tom Latham: 'Obviously not our best performance. We were put under pressure from that massive partnership from Rassie and Quinton up top.'
Tom Latham: 'If we'd had those partnerships and got through those first ten overs we'd have had a chance.'
Tom Latham: 'We're faced with a bit of adversity when it comes to injuries, we'll wait and see how they come out.'
Rassie van der Dussen: 'Quinny and I thought they bowled pretty well up front.'
Rassie van der Dussen: 'We got over the line by a good margin, everyone contributed in the team, it was an out-and-out team performance today.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Glenn Phillips prevented New Zealand from falling to their heaviest ever World Cup defeat with some late power hitting
New Zealand's second-heaviest defeat in World Cup matches was by 215 runs against Australia in 2007
South Africa's relative struggle with closing out games is showing as Phillips tries to single-handedly win the game for New Zealand
